story:
SUCCESSFULLY FUNDED AT 146%!

Thank you all for an amazing campaign!

Miss the deadline? Go to www.redetec.com to pre-order!

ProtoCycler is a new product that allows you to recycle waste plastic into valuable 3D printer filament - safely, quickly, and easily! It comes complete with a built in grinder, intelligent computer control, safety certification, and real time diameter feedback, so anyone can make their own filament hassle free. It also saves you a *TON* of money! Even the cheapest spools are around $30 to buy new, and they can certainly cost much more than that. ProtoCycler lets you make the same 1 kilogram spools for just $5...and if you recycle, your spools are FREE!


This means that ProtoCycler will pay for itself in just 10-20 spools - and as anyone who 3D prints knows, this doesn't take all that long. Never mind all the waste you'll divert from the trash bin. Simply put, if you 3D print, you need ProtoCycler!



WHY WE CREATED PROTOCYCLER

We want everyone to be able to create whatever they wish, without worrying about the cost or the environment. The design technology available today is spurring a revolution in how people think, make, and create. Hacker spaces, Maker Faires, and 3D printers in schools are all evidence of a growing trend that allows anyone to make whatever they want, without needing the time or skill required by traditional manufacturing methods. 


But this technology has so far remained unsustainable. Whether it be the cost of buying new feedstock, or the waste generated as you finalize your design to perfection, true creative freedom is being held back by the consumable nature of the industry. By using ProtoCycler to create filament for your 3D printer from recycled waste or raw pellets, 3D printing becomes both sustainable and affordable. This allows you to unleash your creativity and make what you want, when you want, in any colour you want...for free!


HOW IT WORKS

With just the turn of a crank and push of a button, ProtoCycler automatically creates filament at up to 10 feet a minute, at industry leading tolerances, in any colour you like. This filament can be used with any desktop 3D printer to create whatever you want!

ProtoCycler turns this...

Into this!

And it even spools your filament for you...


ProtoCycler is designed to be the easiest extruder on the market, so it takes care of everything for you. Just select the plastic you want, hit "start", and ProtoCycler does the rest! It really is that simple. For the more adventurous, ProtoCycler will let you experiment with your own settings and custom materials, to create pretty much anything you can imagine. ProtoCycler's open source software and all metal hot end means that if your 3D printer can print with it, ProtoCycler can make it! 


FEATURES

 



TECHNOLOGY

When we first started extruding filament, we used a design similar to the rest of the market. But we were frustrated by the lack of performance, safety, and reliability of those designs - it just took too much time and effort to get usable filament. We ended up having to fundamentally change how filament is extruded to meet our standard for quality - a process that took 2 years iterating through over 10 designs, but was well worth it. Thanks to everything we've learned, ProtoCycler produces beautifully consistent filament, safely and quickly, no matter your skill level.


ProtoCycler is the only extruder that uses patent pending MixFlow™ technology to ensure you get consistent filament, at a speed and efficiency that puts other desktop units to shame. But ProtoCycler doesn't stop there - it has push-button automated control, distributed spooling, and diameter feedback. With all of this technology included right out of the box, it's easy to see how ProtoCycler is the only option when it comes to filament production - feeding your 3D printer with filament has never been so quick or easy! 

Click here for larger version


TECH SPECS:

Diameter tolerance: +/- 0.02mm 

Extrusion speed: Up to 10 ft/minute

Electrical usage: 60 W Average

Dimensions: 14” x 12” x 10”

Grinder input: 5” x 5”

Hopper Capacity: Expandable

Max Temp: All metal hot end for 400+ C

Diameter: 1.75mm, 2.85mm, 3.00mm software adjustable to any diameter between 0,1-3.00 mm


Available with either 110 VAC or 220 VAC with appropriate mains plug for your region - arrives assembled, tested and primed with your choice of PLA or ABS.



TIMELINE AND LOGISTICS

We've spent over 2 years on ProtoCycler so far, but we're not done yet. Bringing a product to market, especially one this groundbreaking, takes real time and effort. We want to be fully transparent with you about our plans going forward, so you can be 100% confident in our ability to fulfill your order. 

We've already done as much prep work as possible pre-campaign to ensure there won't be any huge changes or delays in the future - this includes attempting UL safety certification before we launch, logging over 1000 hours of testing time, pre-manufacturing some units at our quoted cost, and getting preliminary user feedback...all in the name of being as prepared as we can be!

ProtoCycler undergoing Electromagnetic Compatibility testing at UL


But we've taken ProtoCycler as far as we can without knowing just how much demand there will be from you, our customers. Demand fundamentally changes how things are produced, as the most affordable way to make 100 units is different than the most affordable way to make 1000. Time also plays a huge part - we don't want to select a manufacturing method that costs less for 100 units, then find out we have demand for 1000, and take years to fulfill those orders! Therefore, we've held off on the final stages of designing for manufacturing until we know - based on YOUR demand - exactly what the best way to manufacture will be. This allows us to ensure that no matter how many ProtoCycler's are ordered, we'll be able to deliver them as quickly as possible, for the lowest price.


Ideation
We first had the idea for ProtoCycler almost 3 years ago, but it wasn't until the fall of 2012 that we really started to test our ideas. No matter what we tried, we just couldn't get plastic to extrude reliably and consistently, until we discovered MixFlow™ in the spring of 2013.

Prototyping and Product Development
We began to develop ProtoCycler once we'd proven that the concept could work. Over the next 15 months, we prototyped through multiple variations, frequently using our prototypes to recycle themselves into new prototypes! This "Prototype Recycling" is what led to the name ProtoCycler, and was an inspiration to see in action. When we were sure our technology worked, we began preparing it for market. This involved optimizing the performance of our extruder, integrating the entire unit into a beautifully designed enclosure, and beginning to account for cost effective manufacturing. Last but not least, we began our certification process with Underwriter Laboratories, so that there wouldn't be any surprises once we launched our campaign. 


Indiegogo Campaign
Now that our product is completely ready from a functional point of view, we're asking for your help to make it a reality! We'll be doing everything we can to run an open, honest, and responsive campaign, as your feedback as a backer is invaluable to us - so get involved and help us shape the future of sustainable creation! By supporting our campaign, you're helping us bring ProtoCycler to market successfully, and might even unlock some stretch goals along the way...

Fulfillment
Once our campaign is successful, we can begin the final stages of design and fulfillment. We're choosing to delay our design finalization until after the campaign for a number of reasons: it gives us time to incorporate your feedback, and design for the most cost effective manufacturing regardless of our sales total. What this means is that we'll be able to deliver ProtoCycler on time and on budget regardless of whether we sell 100, 500, or even 5000 units. We'll also be able to utilize the feedback from a specially chosen group of beta testers, and will be working closely with UL to ensure any final changes remain completely safe. Once everything is set in place, we'll begin our manufacturing and assembly, perform some final quality assurance and testing, prime your ProtoCycler with the plastic of your choice, and ship them off to you!


THE TEAM

Founders

ProtoCycler is brought to you by a start-up called ReDeTec, which was founded by makers, for makers! With nearly 2 decades of CAD/CAM experience between us, we know that ease of use, reliability, performance and hack-ability are all equally important when it comes to enabling your latest creation - whatever it may be.


Dennon Oosterman has been an avid maker right from his first Lego at age 3. Since then, Dennon has built boats, robots, guitars, UAV's, and a host of other technical projects. Founding ReDeTec is a way of sharing this love of making with the world, and ProtoCycler is just the first step in the creative revolution.


Alex Kay was born in Whistler, B.C., where he grew to love the outdoors and all that nature has to offer. His education in Engineering Physics at The University of British Columbia gave him the opportunity to combine his skills in engineering and design with his passion for the natural world, both traits that show prominently in his work at ReDeTec.


David Joyce is passionate about both financial planning and team management. His talent for keeping projects on track and on budget is invaluable to ReDeTec, and has helped the team create one of the most value-packed products on the market today.

Support Network

Passionate as the three founders are, nothing can make up for hard earned real world experience. That's why we've gathered a fantastic supporting team, who have expertise in everything from UL safety certification, to marketing management and manufacturing logistics. They're working hard to make sure we can deliver the highest quality product at the lowest possible price, and that every ProtoCycler we ship is something you'll be as proud to own as we are to produce it. ReDeTec is the source for renewable design technology, and our support team ensures we'll maintain that lead as we grow and develop our company.

A particularly warm thanks to:

  • UBC Engineering Physics
  • The Bycast Award to Promote Entrepreneurship
  • MaRS 
  • Rotman School of Management
  • Autodesk
  • Underwriter Laboratories
  • Canadian Technology Accelerator
  • Andrew Brown
  • Everyone at Vanhawks, Structur3d, and ORD


WHY WE NEED YOU! 



We've done an incredible amount of work to bring ProtoCycler to where it is today, but now we need your help to finish the journey and bring true creative freedom to the 3D printing world! The realities of manufacturing logistics and economies of scale mean that we can't produce ProtoCycler for a reasonable cost unless we can order a sufficient quantity to justify some tooling costs, and get volume discounts on components. By supporting our campaign, you'll help us reach our minimum order quantity and ensure ProtoCycler becomes a reality.


But ProtoCycler is just the beginning. By pledging, you'll be adding one more vote for a sustainable design future. We want to continue to grow our company and product line, as this will allow us to offer more and more technologies for sustainable creation. Your pledge will directly assist the final development of ProtoCycler, as well as inspire future products that enable a sustainable, design led revolution. So donate today, and support infinite creativity for our future! 



Turn Waste...                                          ...Into Anything!


QUESTIONS & ANSWERS

 Where can I find details on the stretch goals?
Right here!

New colours - 100k and every 75k after

Don't like the brushed aluminium finish? At 100k, we'll add a new colour option! We'll continue to add a new colour choice for every 75k raised after that - so 2 choices at 100, 3 at 175, 4 at 250...etc etc. We'll ask our backers to vote on which new colours they most want to see.

New connectivity - 250k

We're pretty excited about this one. If we hit 250k, we get enough of a volume discount to include WiFi with ProtoCycler. Monitor ProtoCycler remotely, have your phone set off an alarm when the spool is finished, pre-heat ProtoCycler on your way into the lab...or just use full manual mode without a pesky USB cable. Will include mobile apps for running ProtoCycler entirely from your phone!

New protection - 500k

ProtoCycler is already super reliable, but we understand that increased peace of mind can sometimes be invaluable - so at 500k, we'll step up our support network and warranty. We haven't finalized this yet, though, as we want to know what YOU guys want warranty-wise...full replacement after a few months? Unlimited tech support for a few years? a combination of the two? Comment and let us know! 

New plastics* - ???

This one isn't quite ready yet. We want ProtoCycler to support automatic extrusion of as many plastics as possible out of the box - not just ABS and PLA. We really wanted to add this as a stretch goal right now...but we just haven't confirmed fully automatic operation with enough plastics yet, and didn't want to promise something we weren't positive we could deliver on. That being said, we do really want to do this, so we'll be working overtime to try and deliver this before the campaign ends. It will likely be staged similarly to the new colours, but much smaller stages and starting a little later...think Nylon & HIPS at 150k, PET at 175k, HDPE at 200k, LDPE at 225k, etc etc.


 How do I pay without PayPal? It says I have to have an account!
Unfortunately, our previous workaround stopped working pretty quickly. If you want to buy a ProtoCycler but can't use PayPal, e-mail us at info@redetec.com
 What diameter filament will ProtoCycler extrude?
Short answer: 1.75mm, 2.85mm, 3.00mm
Long answer: ProtoCycler has real time diameter feedback that you can easily adjust to any diameter you want, up to 3.00mm. We might end up using separate nozzles for <=2.00mm and >2.00mm extrusion sizes, but as of right now ProtoCycler is user adjustable to extrude any  diameter between 0.1mm and 3.00mm, without a nozzle change.

 Why is it more expensive than some of the other extruders available? Why aren't the parts (Grinder, extruder, etc) sold separately?
We've done an incredible amount of work to ensure we're offering the highest value unit on the market. We are the only extruder available today to come with a grinder and spooler built right in, and the only extruder at all with MixFlow technology and full automation.

By combining the grinder, extruder and spooler in one unit, we're saving costs by eliminating redundant packaging, housings, etc - the savvy shopper will notice it's around $900 to get an extruder, grinder, and spooler individually through our competitors. We firmly believe we're offering the highest quality product on the market, and have done a lot of work to bring the price down to make it the most affordable as well!

 Is it really that simple to use?
Yes! In automatic mode, all you have to do is select your plastic, and hit “go” -ProtoCycler takes care of the rest. Startup, shutdown, extrusion, and spooling are all automatically controlled, so you get fantastic filament, every time.

 What does UL Safety Certified mean?

UL stands for Underwriters Laboratories, the world leader in safety certification. We're working with them to ensure ProtoCycler is as safe as it possibly can be. Unlike other extruders with exposed heating elements, potentially dangerous wiring, and a lack of thermal cutoffs, ProtoCycler has been designed from the start with safety in mind. But don't just take our word for it – UL is certifying it!

 What colours can I make?

Any colour you can think of! Opaque or transparent, bright or subdued, and even spools that change colour throughout. With ProtoCycler, your freedom isn't limited by colour selection –create with confidence, in any colour you like!

 How much is international shipping?

It really depends where you live! We're working our hardest to minimize shipping costs to anywhere in the world, and they'll only get lower as more people pledge. If/When we succeed, we'll send out a survey with shipping options to all of our international backers - any additional costs will be dealt with then, when we've gotten the maximum volume and corresponding lowest price. That being said, we're estimating an additional cost between $25 and $75 depending on volumes and where you live. 

 What is MixFlow™ technology?

MixFlow™ extrusion technology is our patent pending solution to home extrusion. All of our competitors try to shrink down industrial level technology, and it just doesn't work as well as it could. We re-invented extrusion technology from the ground up, and the results speak for themselves: Smaller footprint, faster extrusion, drastically improved energy efficiency, and fully automatic control, are all things made possible by MixFlow™ technology!

 How long does it take to make a 1kg spool?

That depends a little bit on which plastic you're trying to make, but it should take around 2 hours to extrude 1 kg.

 What is distributed spooling, and why do I care?

Distributed spooling means that your filament is evenly distributed on a spool, instead of bunched up in the middle. This ensures tangle free spools for hassle free printing, every-time.

 How is the grinder powered?

By you! Our hand crank has been engineered to provide the fastest, easiest grinding possible. Why not a motor? The main concern is safety –we just couldn't live with the possibility, however small, that the grinder could stay powered while your hand got stuck. Hand cranking ensures the safest experience possible, and also helps to keep costs as low as we can.

 Which plastics can I use?

Right now, our software supports automatic extrusion of ABS and PLA. However, our hardware can grind and extrude any non-toxic thermoplastic, if you care to venture into manual mode (see below). And, we're working around the clock with our ever growing community to add automatic support for more and more materials!

 What is full manual mode for / why is the software open source?

Full manual mode is for when you want to venture off the beaten path, and try something totally new. Whether it's extruding a standard plastic even faster, slowing things way down to feed your 3D printer in real time, or trying out a brand new type of polymer –manual control let's do anything you want, even if we don't support it in automatic mode. Combined with our open source software, you can do literally anything you want with ProtoCycler. We want to build an active community that works together to recycle as much plastic as possible, and full software access is our way of making that happen.

 So is everything open source?

No, sadly not. One section of our extruder - the MixFlow tech - is not. We have to keep this section closed source to protect our investment, but you can still take it apart or hack it to your hearts content (the patent will also be publicly released). Everything else will be fully open source / released at the end of the campaign.

 Can I mix plastics?

In general, no. As with any extruder, only one type of plastic can be extruded at a time. You can still switch plastics, and we're working on compiling a database of which plastics ARE compatible –but for now, every spool you make must be one type of plastic.

 What if I screw up, and put in the wrong plastic?

Nothing too bad. We're working on teaching ProtoCycler what it “feels like” to extrude each different type, so that ultimately it will know if you've messed up, and fix things on it's own! For now though, one of two things will happen –the plastic just won't extrude at all if it needs a higher temperature than the one you've specified, or will come out significantly degraded if it needed a lower temperature than the one you've specified. Either way it's an easy fix, and nothing gets damaged.
story_txt:
SUCCESSFULLY FUNDED AT 146%!Thank you all for an amazing campaign!Miss the deadline? Go to www.redetec.com to pre-order!

ProtoCycler is a new product that allows you to recycle waste plastic into valuable 3D printer filament - safely, quickly, and easily! It comes complete with a built in grinder, intelligent computer control, safety certification, and real time diameter feedback, so anyone can make their own filament hassle free. It also saves you a *TON* of money! Even the cheapest spools are around $30 to buy new, and they can certainly cost much more than that. ProtoCycler lets you make the same 1 kilogram spools for just $5...and if you recycle, your spools are FREE! This means that ProtoCycler will pay for itself in just 10-20 spools - and as anyone who 3D prints knows, this doesn't take all that long. Never mind all the waste you'll divert from the trash bin. Simply put, if you 3D print, you need ProtoCycler!



WHY WE CREATED PROTOCYCLER
We
want everyone to be able to create whatever they wish, without worrying about the cost or the environment. The design technology
available today is spurring a revolution in how people think, make,
and create. Hacker spaces, Maker Faires, and 3D printers in schools
are all evidence of a growing trend that allows anyone to make
whatever they want, without needing the time or skill required by
traditional manufacturing methods. 


But this technology has so far remained unsustainable. Whether it be the cost of buying new feedstock, or the waste generated as you finalize your design to perfection, true creative freedom is being held back by the consumable nature of the industry. By using ProtoCycler to create filament for your 3D printer from recycled waste or raw pellets, 3D printing becomes both sustainable and affordable. This allows you to unleash your creativity and make what you want, when you want, in any colour you want...for free!
HOW IT WORKS
With just the turn of a crank and push of a button, ProtoCycler automatically creates filament at up to 10 feet a minute, at industry leading tolerances, in any colour you like. This filament can be used with any desktop 3D printer to create whatever you want!

ProtoCycler turns this...




Into this!




And it even spools your filament for you...




ProtoCycler is designed to be the easiest extruder on the market, so it takes care of everything for you. Just select the plastic you want, hit "start", and ProtoCycler does the rest! It really is that simple. For the more adventurous, ProtoCycler will let you experiment with your own settings and custom materials, to create pretty much anything you can imagine. ProtoCycler's open source software and all metal hot end means that if your 3D printer can print with it, ProtoCycler can make it! 






FEATURES




 






TECHNOLOGY
When we first started extruding filament, we used a design similar to the rest of the market. But we were frustrated by the lack of performance, safety, and reliability of those designs - it just took too much time and effort to get usable filament. We ended up having to fundamentally change how filament is extruded to meet our standard for quality - a process that took 2 years iterating through over 10 designs, but was well worth it. Thanks to everything we've learned, ProtoCycler produces beautifully consistent filament, safely and quickly, no matter your skill level.



ProtoCycler is the only extruder that uses patent pending MixFlow™ technology to ensure you get consistent filament, at a speed and efficiency that puts other desktop units to shame. But ProtoCycler doesn't stop there - it has push-button automated control, distributed spooling, and diameter feedback. With all of this technology included right out of the box, it's easy to see how ProtoCycler is the only option when it comes to filament production - feeding your 3D printer with filament has never been so quick or easy!

is MixFlow™ technology?
MixFlow™
extrusion technology is our patent pending solution to home
extrusion. All of our competitors try to shrink down industrial level
technology, and it just doesn't work as well as it could. We
re-invented extrusion technology from the ground up, and the results
speak for themselves: Smaller footprint, faster extrusion,
drastically improved energy efficiency, and fully automatic control,
are all things made possible by MixFlow™ technology!



How
long does it take to make a 1kg spool?
That
depends a little bit on which plastic you're trying to make, but it
should take around 2 hours to extrude 1 kg.



What
is distributed spooling, and why do I care?
Distributed
spooling means that your filament is evenly distributed on a spool,
instead of bunched up in the middle. This ensures tangle free spools
for hassle free printing, every-time.



How
is the grinder powered?
By
you! Our hand crank has been engineered to provide the fastest,
easiest grinding possible. Why not a motor? The main concern is
safety –we just couldn't live with the possibility, however small,
that the grinder could stay powered while your hand got stuck. Hand
cranking ensures the safest experience possible, and also helps to keep
costs as low as we can. 


 Which plastics can I use?
Right now, our software supports automatic extrusion of ABS and PLA. However, our hardware can grind and extrude any non-toxic thermoplastic, if you care to venture into manual mode (see below). And, we're working around the clock with our ever growing community to add automatic support for more and more materials!



What
is full manual mode for / why is the software open source?
Full
manual mode is for when you want to venture off the beaten path, and
try something totally new. Whether it's extruding a standard plastic
even faster, slowing things way down to feed your 3D printer in real
time, or trying out a brand new type of polymer –manual control
let's do anything you want, even if we don't support it in automatic
mode. Combined with our open source software, you can do literally
anything you want with ProtoCycler. We want to build an active
community that works together to recycle as much plastic as possible,
and full software access is our way of making that happen.


So
is everything open source?
No, sadly not. One section of our extruder - the MixFlow tech - is not. We have to keep this section closed source to protect our investment, but you can still take it apart or hack it to your hearts content (the patent will also be publicly released). Everything else will be fully open source / released at the end of the campaign.


Can
I mix plastics?
In
general, no. As with any extruder, only one type of plastic can be
extruded at a time. You can still switch plastics, and we're working
on compiling a database of which plastics ARE compatible –but for
now, every spool you make must be one type of plastic.


What
if I screw up, and put in the wrong plastic?
Nothing
too bad. We're working on teaching ProtoCycler what it “feels like”
to extrude each different type, so that ultimately it will know if
you've messed up, and fix things on it's own! For now though, one of
two things will happen –the plastic just won't extrude at all if it
needs a higher temperature than the one you've specified, or will come
out significantly degraded if it needed a lower temperature than the
one you've specified. Either way it's an easy fix, and nothing gets
damaged.

story:
Our team consists of two motivated young idealists. We want to protect in times of data stealing and data abuse people and businesses from access by attackers. Our idea is to be able to guarantee a safe move in the network. For this we provide our encryption and anonymization units that guarantee a perfect symbiosis with our high-performance servers. This solution allows you to have a safe Internet experience. This happens because of a specially developed hardware and software solution and a great server performance. These are installed by hand in countries with the highest data protection laws. These units are easily integrated into the existing home network and automatically connect to our server (Plug and Play), which does not store any user data, and makes tracking impossible. Because of complex encryption measures it is almost impossible for other people to view and analyze your data. You want to be free again and not to have the feeling of being watched? Please support us and we will make together with you a better future in the virtual world.


But why do we need money


  • Staff
  • Office
  • Development
  • Production
  • Server
  • Marketing
  • Infrastructure

This things cost a lot of money so we need your support to realize our vision.


Implementation

Here you can see how it works. The Blacklist on the client and on the server filters bad content on websites like childporns or terrorism. We want an anonymous, free and safe internet but we won't support criminal people!


Timeline


Merchandising


Thank you for your support

story:
The one app for your home

After working as technicians installing smart homes for years it always annoyed us how the solutions that are available on the market were so unnecessarily complicated, inflexible, outdated and costly. That's why we started Future Home - to make a smart home system that "just works" for everyone. With Future Home we wish to empower people to get complete control of all the electronics in their home; all from a single application.

We continuously make sure we keep up with the rapid development of today's smart home technology and make sure we support the latest in smart home electronics such as TVs, home theater systems, etc. We also believe that a smart home should not be accessible from a select few devices and have therefore made sure that the Future Home application is available on any device, be it a smart phone, smart watch, tablet, computer or even glasses.

As featured on:

Features & Benefits

Intelligent Lighting

With Future Home you get simple one-touch light control available from any device. In addition to this, settings are available for you to automate the lighting in your house based on brightness and motion. You can for example set Future Home to turn on a light in a room when it detects a presence there, or turn off all lights when there's no presence in your house.

Climate Control

Automatic adjustments of the temperature in your house is a breeze with Future Home. Timers and house-modes are easy to set up and allow you to efficiently utilize the heating equipment you already have installed in your house. As an example, Future Home can be configured to lower the temperature in rooms when you are away at work or sleeping, and can of course be set to heat the rooms back up again for when you come back home or wake up.

Shading

Annoyed by the sun? Set your blinds or other form of shading to automatically adjust themselves when it's bright outside. You can control everything straight from your phone, so you don't even have to leave your cozy couch to pull the blinds down.

Appliances

Out and about and wish you had a pot of steaming coffee waiting for you when you came home? No worries, open Future Home and turn it on from anywhere. Suddenly realized that you might have left the stove on? Again, Future Home comes to the rescue. Just check the Future Home and turn it off.

Safety and Security

When you're leaving the house you can, with the glance of an eye, check and see if you left a window open and if you remembered to lock all doors. You can even monitor the movements in a room to detect someone's presence.

Power Consumption

Baffled by a high energy bill again? With Future Home you can check the power consumption of every device that's connected to your system and get detailed statistics over the power used. Future Home will also be able to give you warnings and smart notifications related to where you can potentially save power.

And a whole lot more coming

We are currently working hard to add more features and product support and we're already looking into integrations with Sonos, Phillips Hue and Apple's HomeKit. Additional news about this progress will be posted on our blog.

Demo

Want to try out Future Home? Even better: want to annoy us while we're working? Well you can! Follow this link:

Control our office!

How does it work?

"The Wireless Building"

All products included in the Future Home packages communicate wirelessly over RF, giving you near unlimited flexibility when it comes to placement. Throw those wires away and join the wireless revolution!

Reduced Installation Cost

The wireless building can help you save more money than conventional installation solutions as it removes the need for several layers of cables, thus saving time, money and material.

Maintenance-Free

Tired of changing batteries? With Future Home, the components harvest their own energy so batteries are no longer needed. For example, when you press a light switch, the switch will generate enough kinetic energy to send the required signal to turn on or off your lights. Temperature sensors use solar energy as a power supply to report back the temperature in a room (battery powered models are available for rooms without any source of natural light).

Security

All communication in our system is encrypted using either EnOcean radio networks, secure telegrams or the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption protocol (up to AES 256-bit encryption). This is the same functionality used by banks and popular e-commerce services for secure communication.

EnOcean Alliance

EnOcean Alliance is a consortium of companies developing control systems for sustainable buildings. The EnOcean Alliance has the largest number of installed field-proven wireless building automation networks in the world.

Products

Smart Hub

This is the core of the Future Home smart home system. It makes all components in your home work seamlessly together and enables you to control them from anywhere in the world. Great design, high quality components and user-friendliness were all in focus when creating the Smart Hub.

Smart Plug

Simply put, this smart plug provides you with "plug-and-play" control of any appliance, lamp, heater, etc. - anything that can be plugged into a socket. It also offers a complete overview of energy consumption of connected load, meaning you can track just how much power you use making coffee every morning.

Occupancy Sensor

This sensor sends wireless signals when motion is detected, thus enabling you to set up zones where you can be notified of any presence. As with the other components, this sensor also harvests indoor light, making it battery free.

Magnet Contact

Sends wireless signals when a door or window is opened. Combine this with the occupancy sensor and you can detect when someone is inside your house or is entering your house. This sensor also harvests indoor light to power the sensor and wireless communications.

Temperature Sensor

Temperature sensor that accurately senses the temperature in a room. If you did not guess it by now, this sensor also harvests indoor light to power the sensor and wireless communications.

Actuator

This is an in-the-wall mounted actuator that can control lighting or heating, and has the benefit of being hidden from view. In some countries this actuator requires an electrician to install.

Switch

Albeit simple on the outside, this switch contains advanced components that allow it to generate enough kinetic energy to send wireless signals when you press it, effectively removing the need for wires and batteries. It can be set up to control everything in your house, from simple lights to your coffee maker.

The Smart Hub <3 Raspberry Pi


The Future Home Smart Hub is probably the first commercially available smart home gateway utilizing the Raspberry Pi Compute Module. The small form factor, the power of the Raspberry Pi and not to mention the eMMC memory, all makes it the perfect server to run our Debian based, ARM Linux OS and our software packages (written mainly in C++ and modern web code). We strive at making our hardware products just as great as our software, with a constant focus on high quality, high reliability and long product life-cycles.

The Raspberry Pi Compute Module does not only save us from having to "reinvent the wheel", but it goes perfectly in line with our wish of making smart homes readily available and easy to aquire by everyone. As one of the key factors here is of course sensible pricing.

Where we are in development

We are currently ready with a working product, and have spent the last year testing it in our own homes, and with a selection of pilot customers. This has provided us with valuable information in terms of where to focus our development process. We're currently in the process of:

  • Documenting our API
  • Extending our hardware support
  • Expanding the app features and optimizing the design
When we're done with the aforementioned tasks, we'll get straight to:
  • Designing packaging
  • Getting product certification
  • Tooling
  • Production

Meet the people

Erik

Erik is the co-founder and CEO at Future Home. He drives the company’s vision, strategy and growth. He comes equipped with almost 10 years of experience from Bravida and Siemens working on large projects using several different automation solutions.

Sigbjørn

Sigbjørn is the co-founder and CFO at Future Home. He runs the companies finance, administration and marketing. He comes equipped with an MBA from the Norwegian School of Economics (NHH) and start-up experience from California.

Odd Eivind

Odd Eivind is the co-founder and COO at Future Home. He leads the product team in creating meaningful experiences through intuitive design, and oversees Future Home’s brand and product development. He also has several years experience from Siemens and the Norwegian Army.

Bjarne

Bjarne is the co-founder and CTO at Future Home. He oversees the technical strategy of the company, and is dedicated to building a team of world class engineers to keep Future Home at the forefront of the Industry. His experience comes from being a freelance web developer and having a bachelor in Electrical Engineering.

Christer

Christer is responsible for the core software running at the bottom layer of Future Home software. He is a national programming champion and he has a Master in Computer Science from NTNU.

Bikash

Bikash is responsible for all backend services in Future Home software. He is doing his Ph. D in Big data at UiS.

Terje

Terje is responsible for the System Architecture of Future Home software. He has a Master in Computer Science from NTNU.

Arun

Arun work with back end service deployment and is responsible for security of the Future Home platform. He has a Bachelor in Computer Science.

Why we need your support

We have been working on Future Home for the past 18 months and we've come a long way, but now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and manufacturing of our smart hubs so that we can make smart homes available for everyone.

So why should you support us?

  • You're annoyed by too many remote controls.
  • You've stopped using your burglar alarm because it's too complicated.
  • You want to find out why your utility bill is so high and you're interested in ways you can make it smaller.

FAQ

What’s your referral program like?

If you successfully refer 4 friends to pre-order a kit, we will refund the total price of your pre-order if their kits are of equivalent value or larger. We will refund your kit partially if their kits are of lower value.

What kind of protocols does your Smart Hub support?

It has built in support for WiFi, Bluetooth, and EnOcean. However, it also comes with 2 USB ports for future support of other protocols.

Why the EnOcean protocol?

EnOcean products are in use in over 150 000 school, hotels and offices all over the world. It’s a well adopted standard in the industry because of their maintenance-free sensors and switches that utilize energy-harvesting and self-powered technologies. In other words, they don't require any batteries.

What kind of Smart Products can I automate from the app.

Most EnOcean supported products, plugs, actuators, switches, sensors and meters. We are working on support for bluetooth and WiFi enabled products and we're continually adding support for more an more products.

Which EnOcean brands do you support?

Other than the products listed we support products from several other manufacturers. Tested and verified are products from Eltako and Thermokon, but the list is continuously expanded.

Can I control several “Sites” from one app

Yes you can control your home, cabin, boat, caravan, etc. all from the same app and switching is super easy!

Can several users control at a time?

Yes Future Home supports multiple users, and you can even add people as guests, giving them limited access to your home.

Do you have a service plan?

With the Smart Hub, the app and primary services are free they are accessible from as many devices as you’d like. This means that you can download the free app, control devices in your home, automate products, receive alerts, and stream video from cameras and other sensor data.

After the products ship, there will be optional service plans available that include more data options such as storing of events and data over a longer period of time, statistics and reports. These premium plans will have a surcharge but are optional and contract-free. Updates to the app are free as well.

Will you have an open API?

Yes! We are currently working very hard on documenting our API well in order to make it easier for developers and enthusiasts to contribute with their own ideas.

Disclaimer: We will to the best of our ability try to deliver the products on time, but delivery on time in not guaranteed.


Featured In

International
http://gdgtarena.com/2014/09/21/future-home/
http://hypi.st/future-home-self-powered-smart-home/
http://www.geektime.com/2014/11/05/norway-based...
http://www.gizmodo.de/2014/10/08/future-home-das-selbstlaufende-smart-home.html

Norwegian
http://www.tu.no/it/2014/09/10/fjernstyr-kontoret-til-de-norske-ingeniorene
http://www.amobil.no/artikler/norsk-gjeng-satser-alt-pa-smarthus/163722
http://www.teknofil.no/artikler/norsk-smart-home-prosjekt-lar-deg-styre-alt-fra-mobilen/163362

http://elektronikknett.no/Artikkelarkiv/2014/Se...

http://www.aftenbladet.no/nyheter/okonomi/jobb/De-lever-livet-pa-kontoret-3505418.html
http://www.nrk.no/rogaland/40-dagar-med-kaos-1.11915644
http://www.nrk.no/rogaland/studentar-har-fatt-600.000-i-stotte-1.11684906
http://www.uis.no/om-uis/nyheter-og-presserom/smarthus-for-bestemor-article81967-8108.html
http://radio.nrk.no/serie/distriktsprogram-rogaland/DKRO01017814/05-09-2014

http://www.nrk.no/rogaland/barn-er-absolutt-ei-...
http://www.tu.no/karriere/2014/11/04/norske-gru...

story: Colin Anthony - the great improv pianist and organizer of coexisdance (an improv dance series) mobility has been severely worsening. He and his family had to move from their house to an apartment as he can no longer negotiate stairs. This fundraising campaign is to pay for an access ramp to be built for his front stairs.

story:
The Problem

Toilet paper. It was invented in 1857, and people are still relying on it to clean up after trips to the bathroom. That is to say, dry, nonabsorbent paper is supposed to clean up some of the worst messes your body can create. And to make things worse, you have to use your bare hand to assist in the operation, smearing it back and forth until you think you’re clean. It’s barbaric. And what’s worse, a lot of the time it doesn’t even work that well.

And the craziest part about it all – you wash your hands after you’re done pooping, right? Why aren’t you washing the thing that actually created the mess in the first place??? 

 

The Solution

The team here at Brondell believes in washing, not wiping. That’s why we’re working on bringing YOU the  the latest version of the Brondell intelligent bidet toilet seat: the Swash 1400. It’s a bidet that simply replaces the old, “antiquated” seat on your existing toilet.

The Brondell Swash 1400 allows you to leave the gross process of wiping and smearing with toilet paper in the past – where it belongs.

Featuring dual stainless steel sterilized nozzles, and customized nozzle positions, water temperature, water pressure, and spray width, the Brondell Swash 1400 gives you the fresh, clean feeling of having taken a shower after every poop. It’s not just about the wash, though. The Swash also has a warm-air dryer, deodorizer, heated seat, and a soothing night light for those midnight trips to the bathroom. Welcome to your future.

Convinced? Click on one of the rewards to the right to begin your path to bathroom bliss.

Still not convinced? Read on, my friend. 

 

 

The Swash 1400 is jam-packed with awesome features that combine to give you the kind of post-poop clean that used to only happen with a shower! You’ll begin your cleansing process using a remote to control stainless-steel nozzles and spray warm water just where you need it, and finish up with a warm-air blow dryer to make sure you’re ready to continue on with your day. Of course, a lot happens in between, too...just watch the Product Feature Video below to find out what! 

 

 

 

Dual Stainless Steel Nozzles 

Stainless-steel is proven to be more hygienic and longer-lasting than industry standard plastic. Both nozzles are adjustable and positionable in order to hit you “just right”. The oscillation feature gently moves the nozzle back and forth, while on-demand sterilization ensures that your nozzles remain clean and germ-free.

 

Ceramic-Core Water Heating System

No need to wait for warm water to finish your business. When you’re ready, the Swash 1400 is ready for you and “on-demand” heating means you’ll never run out of warm water again!

 

Fully Customizable Wash Settings

Personalize water temperature, water pressure, and even the spray width to your own preferences and retain them with 2 programmable profile settings.

 

Warm Air Dryer

The heated air dryer with adjustable temperature eliminates the use of toilet paper, ensuring you carry on clean, refreshed, and dry.

 

Replaceable Deodorizer

The easy-to-replace 6-month active carbon deodorizer ensures that all bad odors and smells are neutralized at the source, leaving your bathroom fresh and clean.

No matter how hard you try, the gentle-closing lid quietly shuts for a “slam-free” household and, unlike inferior products, our lid is fully “sittable” up to 330 pounds. 

 

 

 

The Swash is easily installed on your existing toilet – no plumber or handyman needed! Check out the Installation Video below to learn how easy it is to turn your boring old toilet into your personal cleansing throne. 

 

 

 

 

 

R&D (Research and Development) started on the Swash 1400 over two years ago, when the Brondell team met with the objective of creating the most advanced, comfortable, and intuitive Swash model we’ve ever offered. 

We invested millions of dollars to go through several rounds of design development that incorporated feedback from our large (and vocal!) customer base, and we eventually landed on a model that incorporated both the features that our customers wanted, and the parts sourced specifically to guarantee the high quality of design our customers have come to expect. That model is what you’re reading about on this page – the Swash 1400.

 

 

 

 

 

Do you have an unusual toilet or questions about your measurements?

Please contact Brondell Customer Service at 888-542-3355, or send us an email at support@brondell.com for additional help. 

 

 

 

Based in San Francisco, California, Brondell is the innovative industry leader in health and wellness products. We currently sell the Swash line of advanced bidet toilet seats, the LumaWarm heated nightlight toilet seat, the Spa suite of entry-level bidet products, the H2O+ line of water filtration systems, and the O2+ line of air purification systems. 

All of our offerings reflect Brondell's commitment to a unique blend of the latest technology and modern design, with a focus on allowing our customers to create healthy homes one room at a time. 

The year was 1990, and Dave Samuel’s high school graduation present was a trip to Japan with his dad. The night before they returned home, Dave excused himself from the table at one of Tokyo’s finest restaurants and made his way to the restroom. Inside he found what looked like a toilet crossed with a computer... it lit up and beeped and had buttons all over it. Being a “techie,” (he was headed to MIT in the fall), Dave immediately started trying to figure out how the thing worked... but he couldn’t read Japanese. That didn’t stop him, though, and the end result was a dousing by the electronic bidet toilet seat. On the way back to the table he had a soaking wet crotch, a bright red face... and an idea. 

 

Over the next few years, Dave did a ton of research, and realized that electronic bidet toilet seats had a huge market presence in Japan – almost every business had one, and nearly as many households did too. But bidets were a totally foreign concept in the United States. Americans had long followed Japanese tech trends, however, and Dave banked on them continuing to do so. His main goal became to combine the cutting-edge technology with a sleek modern design that would complement any North American bathroom and be easy for the customer to install. After finding a manufacturer who could make the seat of his dreams, Dave founded Brondell Inc. in 2003. 

 

Now, here’s where things get interesting. After running into Mark Cuban at a party and pitching him on Brondell’s goals, Dave secured the investment that would put the company on the map. With the backing and guidance of visionaries like Dave Samuel (who sold his company spinner.com to AOL for $320M in 1999), and Mark Cuban (no resume needed there), Brondell Inc. has a track record of using the technology of tomorrow to enrich lives today.

 

 

The entire Brondell team is passionate about supplying people with products that enable them to live their healthiest lives. For us, a big part of that means giving people the option to wash themselves clean (instead of wipe themselves dirty) by using a bidet seat. But despite the fact that bidets and bidet seats are hugely popular throughout the world (over 82% of homes in Japan alone have electronic bidets!), they still just haven’t caught on in North America, especially with younger generations. And that’s a shame, because who appreciates awesome technology more than millennials? 

Then we realized something: you can’t choose an option you don’t know you have! So we went to work putting together an exciting and informative Indiegogo campaign designed to show people just what their bathrooms (and backsides) were missing. 

Throughout Brondell’s 14 years in business, we’ve always relied on the feedback from our very passionate customers when making improvements to all of our product lines. We are super excited to engage the Indiegogo community and hear your feedback as we continue to improve and refine our next generation(s) of Swash bidet toilet seats. And most of all, we can’t wait for you to join us in washing, not wiping! 

At Brondell, we strive to achieve “clean” in all its forms. We believe in clean bodies, clean homes, and a clean environment, and we’re committed to doing our part to make those things happen. From donating bidet seats to disabled veterans through the “T-Shirts for Troops” organization, to planting trees via Trees for the Future, to donating funds to water.org to secure clean water and healthy sanitation for those lacking such basic fundamental rights, here at Brondell we’re passionate about improving the way people live their lives. It’s our most important work.

 

 

Help us grow our Swash 1400 community! Take a minute to hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who would love a bidet! Clean tushy, happy person! 

 

 

 

 

 

Common FAQ's

What is a Swash Luxury Bidet Seat?

Isn’t it obvious?! Ok, maybe not. A Swash is an advanced electronic bidet toilet seat that uses a remote control to position and spray a fresh and hygienic stream of water from stainless steel nozzles when you’re finished using the bathroom. It comes with loads of other cool features, too… just check out our Feature Section!

How does the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat work?

Have a toilet? Awesome – you’re halfway there! Just lose the seat…because the Swash replaces your existing toilet seat. It delivers a warm-water wash through two self-cleaning, positionable nozzles that spray with different temperatures, pressures - all controlled by the included remote. One nozzle’s spray is directed at your behind, and the other is targeted at a more “frontal” position (this is sometimes called the feminine wash). Together they make sure that no spot on your…erm, undercarriage is left unclean. Oh, and the seat’s heated. Cause no one like a cold tushy on a winter night, amiright?

Where is the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat manufactured and serviced?

The Swash bidet seat is manufactured in our existing factory in South Korea. All of Brondell’s products are serviced in San Francisco, CA, USA. (No cable cars are harmed in the servicing of our products).

What is your Warranty policy?

The Swash 1400 comes with a three-year limited warranty.

When will I receive my order?

We expect to ship and deliver orders to our backers by the end of March, 2017 – giving you a whole ‘nother meaning of “spring cleaning!”

How will you ship the product to me and where will this ship from?

Your new best friend….I mean new bidet seat will ship by UPS Ground (US shipments) directly from our warehouse in Effingham, IL and by the best method available for shipments in Canada directly from our Canadian warehouse in Toronto, ON.

Will the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat fit my toilet?

Absolutely! The Swash 1400 comes in both an Elongated and a Round size, and is designed to fit on 98% of residential toilet fixtures in North America.

What size bidet seat do I need?

To determine the size of your toilet, just consult the Toilet Fit Guide. And if you’re still unsure, what’s wrong with you!?

Kidding. If, after measuring your toilet setup while consulting the Toilet Fit Guide, you still can’t determine whether you have an Elongated or Round toilet, give our customer service line a call at (888)542-3355 and we’ll sort you out. Our customer service agents will also be able to help you determine the size of your toilet should measurements prove tricky.

When do I choose my size?

At the end of the InDemand campaign, we’ll send a survey to you asking for your shipping address, choice of size (Round or Elongated), and choice of color (White or Biscuit).

What installation is required?

Standard installation is quick and easy. And we’re not just saying that so you’ll buy it, only to be left in the toilet lurch once you get it home. No, we really mean it.

The vast majority of our customers do the installation themselves, without needing to hire a plumber or handyman. Standard installation involves a few simple steps that are shown in the Installation Video in the section above. Please note that a standard grounded outlet is required to power the Swash. (Unless you possess the power of electrokinesis, in which case we want to be your friend).

I have a skirted toilet with no access to the tank or the toilet seat mounting bolts of my toilet.

How do I install the Swash?

Let’s start with the good news - The Swash 1400 comes with all of the plumbing and mounting hardware necessary to install the bidet seat on a traditional toilet. Now for the not-so-bad news: your super-fancy modern toilet could pose a couple difficulties during installation, but (probably) nothing you can’t handle!

In these instances, we recommend purchasing our alternate T-valve option, found on the Brondell website. The T-valve will connect at the shut-off valve at the wall, instead of under the toilet tank. If your fixture also only has top-side access to the toilet seat mounting bolts, you will likely need top-mount hardware, which can be found on the Brondell website.

See? Not so bad! Plus, these items can be purchased in advance of the delivery of your new Swash 1400.

What are the plumbing requirements of the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat?

Swash Luxury Bidet Seats are compatible with most residential toilet fixtures in the USA... which means it’ll probably feel right at home on yours. All that’s required to connect your Swash to water is a toilet with a tank or access to a water supply valve at the wall. Keep in mind that wall-mounted toilets require a separate water connection to be installed in order to provide water for your Swash (in this case, hiring a reputable plumber is recommended).

The Swash includes everything that you need to provide fresh water to your bidet utilizing the existing water supply. In the rare case that your water supply line is inflexible, you will need to purchase a flexible water line either online or at any local hardware store to complete the installation (as in many cases, bendy is better).

Do I need an electrical outlet?

Yes. You will need a standard three-prong grounded GFCI outlet. GFCI outlets with an internal safety breaker are common and required in all kitchens and bathrooms. If your outlet is more than three and a half feet from the toilet, all you will need is a grounded extension cord to operate your Swash. (When you choose the right extension cord for your bathroom, it does blend in well, promise).

For those customers interested in installing a new outlet specifically for the Swash, let your licensed electrician know that the optimum location when facing your toilet fixture is to the left side of the fixture underneath the toilet tank. The Swash 1400 operates on a standard 120 volts AC and requires a minimum 15amp circuit.

Can I use this bidet seat outside of North America?

Yes and No. (Best answer ever, right)? CE-certified 220V seats are not part of this campaign, but they will be available for purchase directly from Brondell next year after we launch our 110V version. Due to the complex technology inside the product, you are not able to use our 110V seats with a power converter unless the frequency also matches (60HZ). For this reason, we don’t suggest using the product with any kind of converter.

How much electricity does the bidet use?

The Swash 1400 consumes a maximum draw of 1200 watts (less than an electric kettle!) when heating and spraying water during the bidet functions with all the other functions on the highest settings. When the Swash is not spraying water, but the heated seat is on, power consumption is around 60 watts (about the same as a medium-strength light bulb) and we have an energy-saving Eco Mode to reduce electrical consumption even more.

How much water does this use and isn’t that wasteful?

Actually the Swash uses a very small amount of water – about a tenth of a gallon per use. When you consider that it takes up to 37 gallons of water to produce a roll of toilet paper – you are actually saving water when you use a bidet seat!

How long is the power cord? On which side of the Swash is the power cord?

The power cord is 3.5 feet long, and extends from the left side of the bidet seat when facing the toilet (standing in the “urinal position,” if you will). It is next to the water connection.

Is the Swash compatible with seat elevators or toilet seat risers?

Yup, the Swash is compatible with certain riser styles. You can buy a riser that is for sure compatible with the Swash (complete with all additionally required hardware) on the Brondell website.

What colors are available for the Swash?

The Swash 1400 is available in White and Biscuit (not like the golden, buttery biscuits that sit on Southern tables. Think elegant and understated beige). After ordering your Swash, the email you’ll receive at the end of the InDemand campaign will help you decide which color will best match your existing toilet.

When do I choose my color?

At the end of the InDemand campaign, we’ll send a survey to you asking for your shipping address, choice of size (Round versus Elongated), and choice of color (White versus Biscuit).

How do you operate the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat?

You operate the Swash 1400 by using the wireless remote. (Yep, it’s 2016. Your toilet seat has a remote control). The remote comes with a magnetic dock that can mount to a surface using the adhesive on the back of the dock, or with the provided mounting screws.

Can a Swash be used by children, seniors, and people with disabilities?

Absolutely! Children love using the Swash, and they are wonderful for parents with children who are potty-trained but not yet able to clean themselves. (Parents going through that stage – you know exactly what we mean. And we feel for you). Those who are elderly, or who have limited mobility or other limitations, can especially benefit from using the Swash. It’s no fun having to ask for help to wipe – the Swash lets anyone with mobility issues preserve their bathroom dignity.

Does the seat stay heated at all times?

The heated seat function is controlled by the user. It can be set to one of three temperature settings, or simply turned off (but why would you do that? In the middle of the night, a warm seat is like a cozy butt hug). The Swash 1400 also features an optional Eco Mode, which automatically turns the seat heat down to Low after 10 minutes of inactivity.

What is the duration of the wash?

Pressing the “Rear” or “Front” button on the remote control starts a two-minute wash cycle. Pressing this button once again at any point in that cycle starts the two-minute cycle from the beginning. Pressing the “Stop” button will stop the cycle at any point. Any questions?

How long does the warm water last? Forever you say?

The Swash 1400 uses a ceramic-core on-demand heating system which provides "endless" warm water washes, unlike tank systems that run out of warm water before you’re ready and give a shocking blast of cold water exactly where you don’t want it. The standard, uninterrupted wash time for either the Front or Rear wash is two minutes, but can be extended by simply pressing the wash button during the cycle (no judgment here if it takes you twenty minutes to get out of the bathroom).

What is the difference between “Front” and “Rear” on the Swash remote control?

The Front Wash provides a feminine hygienic cleanse (which our lady customers find particularly useful), while the Rear Wash offers a posterior wash for both men and women (after all, everybody poops!).

Do the nozzles ever "get in the way?”

No way! The nozzles are only extended during the wash cycle. At all other times they are housed inside the unit and out of the way. As a further safeguard, the wands self-clean themselves with a high-pressure spray of water before and after each use.

For an extra level of hygiene and peace of mind, the Swash 1400 also features on demand nozzle sterilization, which you can activate at the touch of a button.

Is the Swash safe and reliable?

The Brondell Swash is cETL certified for both the US and Canada for electrical safety standards and is also cUPC certified for both the US and Canada for plumbing safety standards.  The Swash 1400 is covered by a limited three-year warranty.

With proper usage, Brondell products will provide years of reliable use. Owners should read and follow all safety precautions in the literature provided with the product. Pretty standard, you know?

What is the weight limit of the Swash Luxury Bidet Seat?

The Swash lid has a weight limit of 270 pounds. The seat has a weight limit of 330 pounds.

What prevents the Swash from spraying water when someone isn’t on the toilet?

The Swash Luxury Bidet Seat will not work unless someone is sitting on it (we did that on purpose). There is a skin conductivity sensor on the seat that detects contact from your skin. Triggering that sensor is what activates the Swash. We kinda figured you didn’t want some bidet newbie playing with the remote and triggering a Bellagio-like fountain in your bathroom.

What maintenance is required?

Swash seats are made of germ-resistant plastic, and can be cleaned with a soft, wet cloth and a mild detergent. For complete cleaning (hey, we all need it from time to time), the Swash 1400 features a quick-release button to separate the seat from the mounting bracket.

Although Swash nozzles are self-cleaning, we recommend that they be cleaned with a soft brush as needed, and that the removable mesh filter be cleaned every 6-8 months and the carbon deodorizer should be replaced once every 6 months.
